results.content: Easy to follow and concepts are nicely communicated. Not really difficult stuff but the instructor made it interesting enough. The instructor likes to "go ahead" and "jump into" teaching a lot of things.

results.content: Great content if you like to be creative. I would have given 5 star, but the instructor moves a little too fast to really absorb the content. Also, I don't like the bright colors, but that's just me!
results.content_html: Great content if you like to be creative. I would have given 5 star, but the instructor moves a little too fast to really absorb the content. Also, I don't like the bright colors, but that's just me!

results.content: I was very impressed with this course. If you have just a little javascript ,html, and css3 knowledge, you can follow through this course with ease. You get a thorough explanation of why the code works.  Ben explains everything very well. My only (tiny) problem is this; like a lot of people who really know the material, he sometimes talks very fast, making it hard for me to keep up with typing code. Rewinding is not a problem, so it’s still a 5 star course.

You get a thorough explanation of why the code works. Ben explains everything very well. My only (tiny) problem is this; like a lot of people who really know the material, he sometimes talks very fast, making it hard for me to keep up with typing code. Rewinding is not a problem, so it’s still a 5 star course.

results.content: It explained excact what it promised, so you are up and running with it in a short time. I like this kind of clean examples.

results.content: I have learned how to use different kind of materials and technologies to make beautiful sites with this course! It will help me make more elegant projects, exploring canvas, animations and jQuery,  I could make interesting improvements on my tests projects. You have made a good course, I liked the structure of the videos and the steps to achieve professional effects in web visualization. I think that this course is right for everyone who works with web and need to improve their experience techniques for the user, this course is really powerful and I am very happy with what I have learned!

results.content:
When I think of web visualization I think of data visualization libraries like D3. This course is not about data visualization but manipulating HTML5 elements, including SVG and canvas elements with CS3 and JavaScript, with a little jQuery thrown into the mix. The author, Ben Fhala, has broken the content down into chunks that can be easily digested, one at a time, or in groups. I completed the course over 7 days as I was busy coding most of the day. The organization of the course facilitated this approach as the modules build on each other but standalone in terms of concept and delivery. 

Although I was familiar with CS3, HTML5, SVG, and Canvas I found myself rethinking how I used each in my projects. I was made aware of techniques I had overlooked.

Ben's delivery was excellent and the course pedagogy consistent with best practices in online course development.

I highly recommend this course to both beginners and intermediate web designers and programmers.

Thanks Ben :-)

Although I was familiar with CS3, HTML5, SVG, and Canvas I found myself rethinking how I used each in my projects. I was made aware of techniques I had overlooked.

Ben's delivery was excellent and the course pedagogy consistent with best practices in online course development.

results.content:
This course is presented in a logical order, incrementally building up increasingly complicated visual design elements.  The material is presented in a very clear manner, and the instructor is easy to listen to.  
The pace of presentation can be controlled.  If you want to increase or decrease the playback speed, that's easily done.
All things considered, this is a very good course.  I recommend it.

All things considered, this is a very good course. I recommend it.

results.content: The content is applicable and relevant.  Easy to follow and understand.  Could have been a bit more prepared with the colors he wanted in lecture 4 with the gradients, but he recovered nicely.  5 stars for this one because he covers some advanced topics effortlessly.  With CSS it's not always necessary to dive into the technical why, which he balances very well.  The manner in which he teaches new methods are very clear and easy to remember.  Good job!  I've learned a lot of new tips.
results.content_html: The content is applicable and relevant. Easy to follow and understand. Could have been a bit more prepared with the colors he wanted in lecture 4 with the gradients, but he recovered nicely. 5 stars for this one because he covers some advanced topics effortlessly. With CSS it's not always necessary to dive into the technical why, which he balances very well. The manner in which he teaches new methods are very clear and easy to remember. Good job! I've learned a lot of new tips.
